newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton eases as cash crunch hits demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton eases as cash crunch hits demand.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates slipped on Monday amid low demand from mill owners and dealers said prices would soften as buyers were short of funds.

"Most deals these days are done on credit because the mill owners are short of cash," dealer Kishan Chand said. "There is no demand from exporters which has put prices under further pressure. The rates will go down further in the coming days."
In the kerb, NIAB-78 variety was quoted between 1,900 ($47.24) to 2,000 rupee per maund (37.32 kg).
